title: Montreal Canadiens - Defensive Zone Denials Analysis 2024-2025
description: Measures Montreal's ability to prevent opponent entries into their defensive zone
hockey_context: Defensive Zone Entry Prevention Defensive zone denials are critical defensive plays where Montreal prevents opponents from gaining entry into Montreal's defensive zone with possession. This is the first line of defense and directly impacts opponent scoring chances and possession time in dangerous areas.
common_situations: Neutral zone pressure forcing opponent turnovers before zone entry
Gap control by Montreal defensemen to deny controlled entries
Active sticks and body positioning to break up entry attempts
Forechecking pressure limiting opponent breakout options
Defensive zone line battles where Montreal regains possession
Limiting opponent cycle opportunities when entries do occur

key_metrics_explained.DZ Denial Rate: Percentage of opponent entry attempts Montreal successfully prevents (higher = better defense)
key_metrics_explained.Gap Distance: Average distance Montreal defenders maintain from opponents (optimal gap control for denials)
key_metrics_explained.NZ Denials: Neutral zone turnovers preventing entry attempts (proactive defense)
key_metrics_explained.Entry Denial Rate: Success rate at the defensive zone line (last line of entry prevention)
key_metrics_explained.Without Cycle/Shot/Slot percentages: When opponents do enter, how often Montreal limits their effectiveness

schema: Average Controlled Entry Against Gap Distance
Overall DZ Denial and Exit Percentage
Entries Against Without Cycle Pass Percentage
